General course objectives:
General course objectives
To run a group project related to applied/preparative chromatography in the biomanufacturing industry, including aspects of innovation and group dynamics. The project will include literature survey, basic and more advanced mathematical models.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
describe chromatography processes applied in down stream processing of biomanufacturing products
solve fundamental problems related to chromatography
perform a literature survey and write a literature report on preparative chromatography
mathematically model chromatography in a column
mathematically model diffusion in a single particle
synthesize a combined column and single particle model
understand and apply the state-of-the-art CADET simulator
perform a project in a group of students
understand and describe group dynamics and innovation processes
disseminate project results in a technical report
Content:
The course will include visit to an industrial site with thorough introduction to chromatography, lessons related to group dynamics and innovation processes, lessons with lectures and exercises related to chromatography, literature survey of preparative chromatography, developing mathematical models for a chromatographic column with linear and non-linear adsorption isotherms (excluding diffusion), developing a mathematical model for diffusion and adsorption in a single particle, synthesizing a combined column and diffusion model, and introduction and application of the state-of-the-art CADET simulator.

The literature survey and models will be disseminated in a technical report and presented at an oral examination.
